power.name: Escort
power.text: The next time a hero target would be dealt damage, redirect that damage to Madcap, then you may draw a card and play a card.

ul.li: Redirect the next damage dealt to a hero target to another hero target.
Select a hero. The next damage dealt to that hero is irreducible.
Play the top card of the villain deck. One player may take a full turn now.

text.p: Assault deals 1 target 4 melee damage.
If it's not your turn, redirect all damage dealt by that target to Assault until the start of your turn.

quote.text: Assault leapt to meet him, open hand outstretched in some ludicrous parody of a high-five... and launched Leviathan skyward and away with a touch.

text.p: Assault deals 1 target 2 melee damage. The next time that target deals damage, you may play a card.
If it's not your turn, Assault deals each non-hero target 2 projectile damage.

quote.text: Assault moved to kick one of the desks. It went flying into the air in the same instant I threw myself to the ground.

text.p: Assault deals up to 2 targets 2 melee damage each.
If it's not your turn, reduce damage dealt by those targets by 1 until the start of your turn.

quote.text: The hit didn't feel that hard, but it sent me sliding across the floor, into a trio of chairs with plastic seats.

text.p: Assault deals 1 target 1 melee damage.
If it's not your turn, redirect the next damage dealt by that target to a target of your choice.
If it's your turn, return this card to your hand.

quote.text: Assault was a kinetic energy manipulator, and could control the energies of motion much like other heroes could manipulate flame or electricity.

text.p: Assault deals 1 target 3 melee damage.
If it's not your turn, damage dealt to that target is irreducible until the start of your turn.

quote.text: It struck him and the vehicle virtually bounced off of him, the hood crumpling as though it had hit a telephone pole.

text.p: Discard any number of cards. Draw X cards, where X = 1 + the number of cards you discarded in this way
If it's not your turn, you may destroy an Ongoing or environment card.

quote.text: "Felonies, sure, but I haven't killed anyone, and that's got to be worth something. Now, this is just a suggestion, but what if I switched sides?"

text.p: Select a hero other than Assault. Increase damage dealt by that hero by 1 until the start of your next turn.
If it's your turn, that hero may play a card or use a power now.

quote.text: Weld was approaching, and Assault stood ready to attack. Not like he had anything to lose.

card.name: Unprofessional Behavior
card.text: The first time a villain target would deal damage to a hero target each turn, Assault deals that villain target 1 melee damage.

quote.text: "I'm talking a fast, hard hitting strike. Attack is always preferable over defense."

text.p: As long as it's not your turn, increase damage dealt by Assault by 1.
Whenever Assault is dealt damage, you may play a card. If you do, destroy this card.

quote.text: Two PRT soldiers stepped forward to try to spray him with foam, but he dispatched both with a throw of something that looked like a thick frisbee.

card.name: Kinetic Charge
card.text: Whenever Assault would be dealt 2 or more damage at once, you may either reduce that damage by 1 or increase the next damage dealt by Assault to a non-hero target by 1.

quote.text: He used the energy from Battery's kick to rocket towards us, as Battery moved around to flank.

text.p: Whenever damage is redirected, you may increase or reduce that damage by 1.
Whenever Assault would deal damage, you may change that damage to the type of your choice.

quote.text: Grue directed a stream straight at Assault, but the first second of fire seemed to skim right off the man.

text.p: At the start of the environment turn, you may play a card.
When an environment card would enter play, you may discard it instead. If you do, destroy this card and Assault deals 1 target 3 projectile damage.

quote.text: Madcap rebounded off of the wall as though he were made of rubber and ducked beneath her incoming kick.

card.name: Madcap Antics
card.text: If the effect of another card would prevent you from playing a card or using a power, you may ignore that effect.

quote.text: She snapped her head to look up and saw him in the middle of a leap over her head. He'd timed it perfectly, so he would be above her when she rounded the corner.
